text: Dragan S. Hajduković (Cyrillic: Драган С. Хајдуковић) (born June 11, 1949), is a Montenegrin physics professor, astrophysicist and physicist, employed to CERN, environmental activist and perennial candidate. In 2002 he became one of the founders of the Montenegrin green politics NGO and later political party Greens of Montenegro. He was a candidate for the President of Montenegro four times, firstly in 1997 election, then in December 2002 and February 2003, both elections were declared invalid due to low turnout,Montenegro poll fails BBC News, 9 February 2003 and finally in May 2003, when he won the third place with 4.4% of votes. He had announced that he would run for president again in 2008, as well in 2018,Hajduković: Kandidovaću se za predsjednika, Vijesti but both times he did not manage to collect enough signatures to become an official candidate.Hajduković odustao od predsjedničke kandidature, PCNEN, 26 March 2018 ==References== Category:1949 births Category:Living people Category:Montenegrin physicists Category:People associated with CERN Category:Montenegrin educators Category:Candidates for President of Montenegro Category:Montenegrin expatriates in Switzerland
title: Dragan Hajduković
